headline: Akaysha Energy’s Waratah Super Battery discharges its first full output to Australia’s NEM
summary_80w: Australia’s most powerful BESS, the 850MW Waratah Super Battery, achieved its first full discharge to the NEM last week.

headline: Queensland’s Energy Roadmap: 4.3GW of short-duration energy storage by 2030, pumped hydro plans revised
summary_80w: Queensland's Energy Roadmap 2025 suggests that by 2030, up to 4.3GW of short-duration energy storage could be operational.

headline: New South Wales electricity prices hit AU$20,300/MWh cap as battery storage captures volatility
summary_80w: On 10 October, electricity prices in New South Wales, Australia, reached the Market Price Cap of AU$20,300/MWh (US$13,307/MWh).

headline: Germany: Federal Network Agency picks 490MW of solar-plus-storage from oversubscribed tender
summary_80w: Germany has awarded contracts to 490MW of solar-plus-storage projects in its latest “innovation” auction for co-located renewables.

headline: ‘The industry is producing more than it can install,’ says Gaëtan Masson as world exceeds 2.2TW of solar
summary_80w: Gaëtan Masson of IEA PVPS warns of overcapacity, collapsing prices and slipping module quality in the new Trends in PV Applications report.

headline: European solar module market reaches supply and price ‘equilibrium’
summary_80w: The European solar module market has reached a “state of equilibrium” in recent weeks, with stable prices and regular demand.

headline: Solar recycling firm OnePlanet awarded R2v3 traceability standard
summary_80w: US solar recycling firm OnePlanet has achieved the R2v3 certification from electronics sustainability non-profit SERI, which represents the “highest standards of traceability”.

headline: NTPC Green signs MoU with Gujarat government to develop 15GW renewable energy projects
summary_80w: NTPC Renewable Energy Limited has signed an MoU with the Government of Gujarat to develop 15GW renewable energy projects in Gujarat.

headline: Australia’s renewable energy project additions slow to 5.8GW in September, says Rystad Energy
summary_80w: Australia's renewable energy sector recorded its slowest month of the year for additions in September, with 5.8GW of new projects added to development pipelines, according to data from Rystad Energy.

headline: US ROUNDUP: Cross-industry collaborations target energy storage growth and accessibility
summary_80w: Honeywell, LS Electric, esVolta, Sitetracker, PairedPower, PHNXX, and Energy Toolbase are collaborating on new initiatives to advance energy storage installations across the US.

headline: UK BESS asset management has moved to ‘disciplined, systems-level approach’
summary_80w: BESS asset management in the UK has moved beyond the rudimentary 'project delivery and basic O&M' approach, a speaker at the upcoming Battery Asset Management Summit UK & Ireland explained in a Q&A.

headline: India’s H1 energy storage installations plunge 74% year-on-year to 49MWh: Mercom
summary_80w: According to the latest report by clean energy market research firm Mercom India, India achieved a cumulative energy storage capacity of 490MWh by the end of June 2025.

headline: Texas utility signs 200MWh BESS offtake agreement with Jupiter Power to combat ERCOT duck curve
summary_80w: Community-owned public power utility Denton Municipal Electric (DME) has signed a power purchase agreement (PPA) with Jupiter Power covering offtake from one of the developer-operator's standalone BESS projects destined for Robertson County in Texas.

headline: NSW Independent Planning Commission approves ACEnergy’s 1,100MWh battery storage system in Australia
summary_80w: The New South Wales Independent Planning Commission has approved ACEnergy's 250MW/1,100MWh Yanco battery energy storage system in Australia.

headline: Entergy to build 600MW solar-plus-storage project in Arkansas to power Google data centre
summary_80w: Entergy Arkansas has announced plans to build a 600MW solar-plus-storage project to support a new data centre to be built by Google.

headline: Sembcorp to acquire ReNew’s 300MW solar unit for US$246 million
summary_80w: Singapore-based Sembcorp Industries has agreed to acquire ReNew’s 300MW solar power unit in India for around US$246 million.

headline: Low prices, fierce competition in Germany’s latest solar-plus-storage auction
summary_80w: Germany has awarded contracts to 490MW of solar-plus-storage projects in its latest “innovation” auction for co-located renewables.

headline: Greenflash Infrastructure secures financing for Texas’s largest standalone BESS
summary_80w: H.I.G. Capital-backed energy platform, Greenflash Infrastructure, has closed a hybrid tax capital and debt financing for Project Soho, a 400MW/800MWh standalone battery storage project in Brazoria County, Texas.

headline: Sungrow files Hong Kong IPO prospectus; strong financials but ‘global trade policy’ risk looms
summary_80w: China-based inverter and BESS firm Sungrow has submitted its application for a Hong Kong Stock Exchange IPO, after a period of strong revenue growth.

headline: South Australia prepares its first 700MW tender for long-duration energy storage
summary_80w: South Australia is set to open a tender seeking 700MW of long-duration energy storage to bolster grid reliability.

headline: Australia’s Capacity Investment Scheme Tender 4 sees 6.6GW of renewables awarded
summary_80w: The Australian government has announced the results of the fourth Capacity Investment Scheme (CIS) tender, with 6.6GW of renewables awarded long-term contracts.

headline: Solar is the world’s cheapest source of electricity, research shows
summary_80w: Solar PV is the world’s cheapest technology to generate electricity, according to a study from the University of Surrey, in the UK.

headline: Avaada signs MoU with Gujarat government worth US$4.05 billion
summary_80w: Avaada has inked an MoU with the Gujarat government to develop solar, wind, and BESS worth INR360 billion (US$4.05 billion).

headline: Sungrow targets US$126 million in Hong Kong IPO
summary_80w: Chinese inverter and storage manufacturer Sungrow has revealed details of its planned flotation on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange.

headline: Pause on ‘billions of dollars’ of retroactive US solar duties granted pending appeal
summary_80w: The retroactive collection of duties on historical solar imports to the US has been temporarily paused pending the outcome of an appeal.

headline: Lithuania expands energy storage support scheme, aims for speedy turnaround
summary_80w: Lithuania’s government will publish a call for applications tomorrow (10 October) for a scheme to support energy storage, which is deemed crucial to the country's energy security.

headline: Huawei signs MoU with GoldenPeaks for 500MWh of European grid-forming BESS
summary_80w: GoldenPeaks Capital (GPC) and Huawei Polska have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on a Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) cooperation focusing on 500MWh grid-forming BESS in Europe.

headline: Australia’s Capacity Investment Scheme Tender 4 sees 11.4GWh of solar-plus-storage awarded
summary_80w: Australia has announced the results of the fourth Capacity Investment Scheme tender, with 11.4GWh of solar-plus-storage contracts awarded.

headline: Battery storage revenues fall 61% as Australia’s NEM navigates market volatility
summary_80w: Battery energy storage revenues in Australia's National Electricity Market (NEM) fell 61% in September 2025 to AU$85,000/MW (US$56,712/MW) as price volatility eased across the grid, according to new research from Modo Energy.

headline: Potentia Energy bags NSW approval for 500MW solar-plus-storage site in Australia
summary_80w: The NSW Independent Planning Commission has granted planning approval for Potentia Energy's 500MW Tallawang solar-plus-storage project.

headline: Responses wanted: Solar & Storage Finance USA to explore sustained appetite for US renewable investments
summary_80w: Despite policy headwinds on the federal level, there is optimism for the future of the US solar and storage sector.

headline: Trump policies to have ‘marginal’ impact on energy transition amid geopolitical disruptions—DNV
summary_80w: The global energy transition will only be 'marginally impacted' by uncertainties in US energy policy, according to Remi Eriksen, CEO of DNV.

headline: Australia’s NEM sets minimum demand record as rooftop solar reaches 15GW
summary_80w: Australia's NEM achieved a new minimum operational demand record of 9,666MW, marking a 4% decrease from the previous record.

headline: Potentia’s 500MW solar-plus-storage site in Australia receives NSW approval
summary_80w: The NSW Independent Planning Commission has granted planning approval for Potentia Energy's 500MW Tallawang solar-plus-storage project.

headline: US solar module prices up following safe harbour deadline rush
summary_80w: US solar module prices jumped in Q3 2025 as developers scrambled to meet the 2 September 2025 safe harbour deadline for Investment Tax Credit (ITC) qualification, according to supply chain platform Anza.

headline: How 35 years of solar evolution in Australia created the ‘world’s most sophisticated grid’
summary_80w: PV Talk: Smart Energy Council's Nigel Morris reflects on how Australia has become a global testbed for distributed solar and storage innovation.

headline: Scatec’s latest Egypt solar project moves forward with financing agreement
summary_80w: Officials from Norway and Egypt have agreed provisional terms for the financing of the Dandara solar park in Egypt, which is being built and operated by Norwegian IPP Scatec.

headline: Researchers claim efficiency and stability records for triple-junction perovskite solar cell
summary_80w: University of Sydney scientists have created the largest and most efficient triple-junction perovskite-perovskite-silicon solar cell on record.

headline: Saatvik Green Energy secures solar PV module orders worth INR7 billion
summary_80w: Saatvik Green Energy has secured new solar PV module orders worth more than INR7 billion (US$84 million), to be delivered in this financial year.

headline: Frontier Energy plans 1GW solar expansion at Waroona Energy Park in Western Australia
summary_80w: Frontier Energy plans to expand its Waroona Renewable Energy Project into a renewable energy precinct by 2031, targeting up to 1GW solar.

headline: Longroad Energy signs Utah BESS offtake deal, tariff-related price adjustments could increase cost by 4.7%
summary_80w: Utah Associated Municipal Power Systems (UAMPS) has negotiated the terms of a solar and BESS power purchase agreement (PPA) with Boston, Massachusetts-based developer Longroad Energy.

headline: Second life sector still needs to meet performance, pricing and safety challenges
summary_80w: Repurposing EV battery packs and modules into BESS obviously has environmental benefits, but challenges around pricing, performance and safety remain, panellists at an industry event in London said last week.

headline: Bitesize takeaways from Energy Storage Summit Asia 2025
summary_80w: Some quick snapshots from the presentations and panels at Energy Storage Summit Asia 2025, taking place this week in Manila, Philippines.

headline: Xcel Energy proposes 200MW distributed battery storage network in Minnesota
summary_80w: US utility Xcel Energy has proposed to build out a 200MW battery storage network across Minnesota, US.

headline: Doral secures offtake agreement for 430MW Texas solar-plus-storage project

headline: Econergy to acquire 155MW solar project in Romania
summary_80w: Econergy will acquire 100% stake in the 155MW Ratesti solar project in Romania, further expanding its European renewable energy portfolio.

headline: Juniper Green Energy signs 70MW PPA with Tata Power
summary_80w: Juniper Green Energy through its subsidiary Juniper Green Sigma Eight has signed a 70MW power purchase agreement with renewable energy giant Tata Power.

headline: Solar PV to drive 80% of global renewables growth by 2030, IEA says
summary_80w: Solar PV will account for almost 80% of the 4.6TW of new renewable power expected to be added by 2030, according to the International Energy Agency (IEA).

headline: OpenSolar raises US$20 million to advance AI platform
summary_80w: OpenSolar has secured US$13.1 million in equity financing from technology investors, including Titanium Ventures, Google and others.

headline: Arevon powers 264MW Indiana PV portfolio with Meta PPA
summary_80w: US independent power producer (IPP) Arevon has begun operations at two utility-scale solar projects in Indiana.

headline: Australia: Queensland solar PV power plants top the utility performance rankings
summary_80w: Rystad Energy has said that Queensland’s utility-solar assets were the best-performing solar PV power plants in September 2025.

headline: Victoria launches incentive program for C&I rooftop solar
summary_80w: The government of Victoria, Australia, has launched the an incentive scheme to encourage businesses to install rooftop solar installations.

headline: BSW-Solar calls for 100GWh of German storage deployments by 2030
summary_80w: BSW-Solar has called on the German government to impose a target of 100GWh of cumulative operational BESS by 2030.

headline: ‘The industry must do a better job of putting BESS safety in perspective’: Prevalon and Honeywell on addressing BESS fire safety
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news Premium hears from a representative from Honeywell and Alejandro Schnakofsky, CTO of Prevalon, on fire safety in the battery energy storage system (BESS) industry.

headline: Eolian and utility CPS Energy begin operating 100MWh Texas BESS
summary_80w: Utility CPS Energy and IPP Eolian have begun operating Padua 1, a 50MW/100MWh battery energy storage system (BESS) located in Bexar County, Texas, US.

headline: Philippines regulator’s ESS market rules will be ‘a watershed moment’
summary_80w: The Philippines needs to establish clearly defined rules for the market participation of energy storage systems (ESS), the chair of the country’s regulator has said.

headline: Virtual battery tolls explained: Revenue certainty in a volatile market
summary_80w: Matt Szwec, an energy trading analyst at Fluence, discusses virtual battery toll agreements and how they operate in Australia.

headline: Battery trading complexity demands software solutions as the Australian market matures
summary_80w: ESN Premium speaks with Fluence's Matt Grover about the need for sophisticated software solutions to enhance battery trading.

headline: Rajasthan launches 2GWh standalone BESS tender after India relaxes VGF guidelines
summary_80w: Rajasthan government will develop 500MW/2,000MWh of standalone battery energy storage systems (BESS) with a four-hour single-cycle configuration and extended operational life.

headline: Rajasthan launches 2GWh standalone BESS tender after India relaxes VGF guidelines
summary_80w: Following the recent notification, the Rajasthan government will develop 500MW/2,000MWh of standalone battery energy storage systems (BESS) with a four-hour single-cycle configuration and extended operational life.

headline: Genesis Energy and FRV Australia dissolve solar development partnership in New Zealand
summary_80w: Genesis Energy and FRV Australia have mutually agreed to terminate their solar development joint venture while maintaining co-ownership of the 63MWp Lauriston solar PV power plant in Canterbury, New Zealand.

headline: How Talon PV plans to crack America’s TOPCon solar cell challenge
summary_80w: Talon PV aims to be the first US company to safely manufacture TOPCon cells at scale, backed by European technology and a crucial First Solar licensing deal.

headline: PVV Infra offshoots secure two India PV projects totalling 209MW; Avaada underway with 1.5GW/2.5GWh Rajasthan PV/BESS project
summary_80w: Indian infrastructure company focused on rooftop and ground-based solar power installations, PVV Infra has secured solar power orders worth INR7.9 billion (US$90 million) through two of its subsidiaries.

headline: BlackRock reportedly poised to buy AES Corporation
summary_80w: US utility AES Corporation is reportedly in discussions to be acquired by Global Infrastructure Partners (GIP), a subsidiary of global asset owning giant BlackRock.

headline: ACME Group launches renewable equipment manufacturing vertical
summary_80w: Indian solar developer ACME Group has established a new subsidiary to manage its renewable equipment manufacturing business, under which it is planning to scale production of TOPCon PV modules.

headline: SMA Solar to cut 350 more jobs
summary_80w: German solar inverter manufacturer SMA Solar will cut 350 jobs in 2026 as it adapts to the “weak” residential PV market.

headline: Over-voltage triggered Iberian blackout – report
summary_80w: An expert panel has identified a series of grid failures that led to April's unprecedented power outage in Spain and Portugal, ruling out renewables as the leading cause.

headline: Nightpeak Energy commences operation of 300MWh Texas BESS
summary_80w: Nightpeak Energy has announced commercial operations of its 150MW/300MWh Bocanova Power battery energy storage system (BESS) in Brazoria County, Texas, US.

headline: AIP acquires 49% stake in BW ESS UK storage portfolio for nearly US$900 million
summary_80w: Asset manager AIP Management has bought a 49% stake in a 2.4GWh UK portfolio from global BESS investment platform BW ESS for a deal in excess of £650 million (US$873 million).

headline: Hithium’s Hong Kong IPO lapses with CATL lawsuit looming
summary_80w: Lithium-ion OEM Hithium's failed Hong Kong listing amidst a lawsuit from larger competitor CATL may point to wider industry trends, with an increasingly competitive and larger battery industry meaning ever higher stakes.

headline: VIDEO: Challenges, lessons learned and analytics in action from operating a BESS for the first time
summary_80w: Energy-Storage.news proudly presents our sponsored webinar with TWAICE, on the role of analytics in helping first-time battery energy storage system (BESS) operators.

headline: US solar manufacturing under the microscope at PV CellTech 2025
summary_80w: The US solar manufacturing industry is feeling bullish, despite the policy whiplash inflicted over the summer and the increased pressure on US solar supply chains.

headline: Sungrow and Engie complete first half of 200MW/800MW Belgium BESS
summary_80w: BESS provider Sungrow and power firm Engie have connected the first phase of a 400MW/800MWh project, one of the largest in Europe, to the grid in Belgium.

headline: Madison Energy Infrastructure buys NextEra Energy Resources’ distributed PV business
summary_80w: Renewables developer Madison Energy Infrastructure has bought the US distributed generation assets of NextEra Energy Resources.

headline: EDF and Enlight advance solar-plus-storage projects in the US
summary_80w: EDF Renewables and Enlight Renewable Energy have advanced solar-plus-storage projects in New Mexico and Arizona.

headline: SunStrong raises US$900 million to refinance SunPower residential portfolio
summary_80w: SunStrong Management has raised US$900 million to refinance a 'large portfolio' of residential solar assets developed by SunPower.

headline: Chinese government policies and production cuts to drive up module prices—Wood Mackenzie
summary_80w: Chinese government policies and supply-side production cuts will drive a significant increase in solar and storage component costs.

headline: EDF, Enlight advance solar-plus-storage projects in Southwestern US
summary_80w: EDF Renewables has brought its 300MWh Milagro project online in New Mexico, while Enlight Renewable Energy has secured US$340 million in tax equity financing for its 940MWh Roadrunner project in Arizona.

headline: Tesla, LG ES Vertech join US Energy Storage Coalition to represent industry
summary_80w: More than 30 stakeholder organisations in the US energy storage value chain have formed a new association to represent common interests.

headline: WaterNSW picks pumped hydro sites with potential to support Australian state’s renewable energy objectives
summary_80w: WaterNSW, the state-owned water supplier to New South Wales, Australia, has selected three dams as suitable sites for pumped hydro energy storage (PHES) developments.

headline: US utility Duke Energy files Carolinas Resource Plan, including 5.6GWh of energy storage
summary_80w: Major US utility company Duke Energy has filed its biennial long-range energy modernisation plan for North and South Carolina, US. The plan includes a 5,600MW battery storage target.

headline: NEM data spotlight: Solar generation surges 18% in September as Australia enters spring
summary_80w: Australia's solar sector delivered a strong September performance in the National Electricity Market (NEM) as the country entered spring, with combined solar PV generation reaching 3,933GWh - a 17.83% increase from August's 3,338GWh.

headline: Spain’s Trabede, Greening Group to build solar module recycling plant
summary_80w: Spanish waste management company Trabede and energy firm Greening Group will build a solar module recycling plant in Granada, Andalusia, Spain.

headline: India has 171GW/279GW solar cell and module manufacturing capacity under construction
summary_80w: The Indian solar industry has 86GW and 182GW of solar cell and module manufacturing capacity, respectively, expected to be commissioned by 2027.

headline: EU to lose 5% of solar workforce in 2025 as ‘job-intensive’ residential market contracts
summary_80w: The European solar sector will lose around 5% of its jobs in 2025, the first contraction in employment for the sector in nearly a decade.

headline: Perovskite-based PV technologies could dominate within a decade, says Qcells CTO
summary_80w: PV products using perovskite technology could assume a dominant position within the next ten years, according to module producer Qcells' CTO.

headline: India launches antidumping investigation on solar encapsulants from South Korea, Vietnam and Thailand
summary_80w: The Indian Department of Commerce has launched an antidumping investigation on solar encapsulants originating or exported from South Korea, Vietnam and Thailand.

headline: SPP utility to invest over US$600 million in 1.9GWh BESS projects to address ‘significant capacity deficit’
summary_80w: Investor-owned utility (IOU) Southwestern Public Service Company (SPS) is seeking approval from the New Mexico Public Regulation Commission (NMPRC) to construct a new eight-project portfolio of self-build energy assets.

headline: Canadian Solar enters agreements with Aypa Power for 2.1GWh BESS projects in Ontario
summary_80w: Solar PV and energy storage firm Canadian Solar has entered into battery storage agreements (BSAs) and long-term services agreements (LTSAs) with Aypa Power for the Elora and Hedley battery energy storage system (BESS) projects in Ontario, Canada.

headline: Italy’s ‘exceptionally competitive’ first MACSE energy storage auction concludes, procuring 10GWh
summary_80w: The TSO of Italy has completed its first MACSE auctions for energy storage, procuring 10GWh of capacity at what the NHOA CEO called 'exceptionally competitive prices'.

headline: Origin, Eku Energy submit 2,200MWh of battery storage applications to Australia’s EPBC Act
summary_80w: Two battery energy storage systems (BESS) from Origin Energy and Eku Energy, totalling 2,200MWh, have been submitted to Australia's EPBC Act.

headline: Quinbrook completes the 560MWh first stage of the Supernode BESS in Australia
summary_80w: Quinbrook Infrastructure Partners has completed construction on the first stage of its Supernode battery energy storage system (BESS) in Queensland, Australia.

headline: VPI and ADS-TEC reveal combined 1.7GW German BESS plans
summary_80w: Power firm VPI has signed a 700MW pipeline BESS joint venture in Germany with developer Noveria Energy, while system integrator ADS-TEC has revealed a 1GW/2GWh project.

headline: ASL to open 500MW firming tender for Sydney-Newcastle-Wollongong in NSW, Australia
summary_80w: New South Wales is set to open its seventh firming tender, seeking approximately 500MW of energy storage to support grid reliability.

headline: The ‘One, Big, Beautiful Bill Act’ brought changes, some clarity to US energy storage development
summary_80w: Energy storage escaped much of the pain inflicted on solar in recent legislative changes in the US, but foreign entity restrictions may create some supply chain challenges, writes April Bonner.

headline: US tariffs on Chinese battery suppliers could trigger global ‘race to the bottom,’ Prevalon CEO warns
summary_80w: In a recently published interview with Energy-Storage.news Premium, CEO and President of Prevalon Energy, Thomas Cornell, spoke about the global consequences of the budget reconciliation bill.

headline: September sees 2.5GWh of BESS approved in UK
summary_80w: Local authorities approved 1,237MW/2,474MWh of grid-scale BESS in the UK, the latest data from our monthly roundup shows.

headline: Japan’s unique challenges offer valuable lessons to energy storage developers across Asia-Pacific
summary_80w: Dr Mahdi Behrengrad, head of energy storage at Pacifico Energy, speaks to Energy-Storage.news ahead of next week's Energy Storage Summit Asia 2025 in Manila.

headline: Australia: AGL’s 1,000MWh Liddell BESS in New South Wales registers with AEMO
summary_80w: Australian energy major AGL has seen its 1,000MWh Liddell battery energy storage system (BESS) in New South Wales (NSW) enter AEMO's Market Management System.

headline: Investor and system integrator discuss deploying both new and second life BESS in Germany
summary_80w: We catch up with executives from second life specialist BESS integrator Voltfang and investor Palladio Partners to discuss their recent €250 million (US$293 million) partnership to deploy projects in Germany.
